Blog.post: DewU points entered: 505 The fun of using Live-CD Linux distributions is starting to wear off. They were just a little too confusing for a noob like me to use. I'm using a new VS, its called urlLink Classix 10k 2.0 and I like it about the same as LunaVX, they are both awesome and so much better than the Windows XP default. I'm going to a wedding today, my cousins. It should be interesting(not really), and hopefully it doesn't last that long. Not that I don't that my cousin is getting married, I think that it's great, but I have never really liked going to weddings. I'm hoping to have 550 DewU points by the end of next week, but it will be close. They still have some green Xbox's left, so I could be lucky enough to get one. Have to go get ready to go to the wedding, bye.

urlLink ATI to launch two PCI Express cards next week : "IN TAIWAN, AT COMPUTEX ATI will introduce two of its PCI Express cards." Now I have to wait until PCI Express motherboards come out so I can get one of these to put into my new computer. I may get lucky and have them both get out in June so I'll have my new computer before my birthday.

urlLink First 64-bit Malware for Windows Appears : "The proof-of-concept threat is not spreading in the wild, and it only affects 64-bit Windows systems. Symantec Security Response has revealed that it has analyzed the first 64-bit Windows attack code." It was only a matter of time, but at least it was not made for Itanium instead of Opteron or Althlon64.
There it be. urlLink urlLink

DewU points entered: 491 After looking around, I have decided that Gnoppix looks a lot better that Knoppix, I like the Gnome desktop environment more than KDE(downloading it now). Hey, slightly funny thing happened today. At work, they have a two hour limit on computer time, and since my job involves very little work, I'm on the computer most of the time. A lot of the time I just ask for the Guest card to use if I waste all of my minutes, but today I decided to try something new. I brought my Knoppix CD with me to work, and when my two hours were up I popped it into the drive(For some reason they have the Bios accessible and the boot order already started with the CD-rom drive,ehh makes my life easier)and it brings me to the screen that asks whether I want to start it up, I say yes. Then the CD-rom drive starts making the loudest noises I have ever heard a drive make. It was about ten times louder than my CD drive! So I quickly took it out as soon as I could and tried to act like nothing happened. Oops! David Copperfield is progressing slowly, not that the book is slow to start off, but more the fact that I spend way too much time on the computer and don't spend any time at home reading. Most of my reading gets done in class, when I have nothing better to do, and have no computer to go on to. I'm either going to read another Charles Dickens book or a book by H.G. Wells once I'm finished with David Copperfield. I expect to post another picture of my house soon, after the brick has been clean and when it's sunny out, it looks very nice. ...I think this may be the longest post I have done, not counting BlogThis! posts, I find this to be a good indicator that I may be getting better at typing. That's it for now, can't think of anything else to write about.

urlLink 'Pirate Act' raises civil rights concerns | CNET News.com : "File swappers concerned about getting in trouble with record labels over illegal downloads may soon have a major new worry: the U.S. Department of Justice." This better not get passed, as it will probably cause me to have to stop sharing files, by either having my parents tell me to stop or by having myself be too afraid to do it. I may have to become a "leecher"(shudders at the thought). I'll just have to cross my fingers it does not get passed. P.S. Uhmmm...I don't actually indulge in such illegal activities and do not support anyone who does, so don't tell anyone I do because I don't(yeah..rightttt)

DewU points entered: 465 Decided to try out the Gentoo live-cd also, so I can hopefully find a distribution that I like by testing out the live-cds. Only 85 more points to go, and the Xbox shall be mine. Going to a wedding on Saturday, my cousin is getting married. I'd rather be going to another Halo marathon, but it's my cousins wedding, and I think I should do the right thing and go to it. I've almost had a Blog for a whole month, yay me. G4 is going to be finishing up their takeover of TechTv on Friday, which sucks because the shows I've seen on G4 all are horrible. Unfortunately, there is nothing I can do about it, but at least they are keeping urlLink The Screensavers . Have to go burn a Gentoo Live-cd, so I'll end my post.

DewU points entered: 454 Knoppix is great! I guess a lot of people probably say that after being on Windows computer their whole, but still, its very interesting to try out a new OS. In fact, I'm making this post in Knoppix. This may make me make a partition on my computer for something like Mandrake(I've heard that it's the best for newbies). I've also decided to take a break from reading new books all the time, and to try out some classics. I just finished Frankenstein, and have now started on David Copperfield. Frankenstein wasn't as bad as I thought it might be, and David Copperfield is shaping up to be a good book as well. I'm off to see if I can set up BlogThis! to make some more posts in Knoppix.

DewU points entered: 432 Yep, only one new point entered today, I have more but I don't remember where they are. Hopefully I'll find them tomorrow. I plan on trying out Knoppix tomorrow, looks very interesting, I've always wanted to try Linux but didn't want to go through the hassle of installing it on a partition and dual booting with Windows. It should be interesting. That's all for now, have to get some sleep.

urlLink Yahoo! News - Convicted Bus Driver Must Watch Surgery : "An Argentine bus driver must watch surgery being performed on a traffic accident victim as part of his punishment for striking and killing an 11-year-old boy, a judge said on Friday." Wow, they are very "creative" over in Argentina, but I mean really, just put the guy in jail, it seems kind of like they are letting him off easy. I know surgerys aren't fun to watch, but still, only having to watch a surgery after killing someone doesn't make much sense. P.S. I apologize for two BlogThis! posts in about five minutes, just trying to get everything in before I have to get off.

urlLink Wired News: Kerry Gets Google-Bombed : "With the Democratic presidential nomination clinched, John Kerry was bound to get Google-bombed. An effort by conservative bloggers has pushed the candidate's campaign website to the top of the result list when the word 'waffles' is typed into Google." HaHa! Kerry. I hadn't heard about the "dumb motherfucker" bomb on Bush though, very interesting. Why would you think up the word waffles? Ah, who cares, still a great Google-bomb.

urlLink Yahoo! Movies: Weekend Box Office Report : "'Shrek 2,' a cartoon revolving around a green ogre and his princess bride, trampled even the most optimistic forecasts as it set several new opening records at the weekend box office and kick-started the lucrative summer movie-going season into high gear. The animated sequel sold about $125.3 million worth of tickets in its first five days of release across North America, its distributor, DreamWorks, said on Sunday." Wow! Now I wish I had seen it this weekend so I could add to that total. Even though I added it to my favorite movies list, I haven't seen it yet, but I know it will be great.
There it is, kinda wet when the picture was took, and bricks hadn't been cleaned off yet, I'll try and get a better one soon. urlLink urlLink

It is white! Wow, very white. It's minimalistic and looks pretty neat. That's okay I'll probably change it when I'm not so tired. Have to go work at the property where we are building our new house tomorrow, so I should probably get to bed. Maybe I'll put a pic up of the house tomorrow.

urlLink Gmail's Terabyte Glitch Heightens Storage Race : "Gmail's Terabyte Glitch Heightens Storage Race By Matt Hicks May 19, 2004 The e-mail storage race appeared to have reached a new height this week when test users of Google's free Gmail service noticed having not just 1 gigabyte of storage, but 1 terabyte." This amuses me. Good job Google, that's a sure way to get people to use your email, give them a terabyte to store their emails. To bad it's not real, that would be awesome, although they would probably have limits on the size of the emails you could send, even if they were able to offer that much storage.

urlLink Freeware : "RegSeeker 1.35: RegSeeker is a perfect companion for your Windows registry ! RegSeeker includes a powerful registry cleaner and can display various informations like your startup entries, several histories (even index.dat files), installed applications and much more ! With RegSeeker you can search for any item inside your registry, export/delete the results, open them in the registry. RegSeeker also includes a tweaks panel to optimize your OS ! Now RegSeeker includes a file tool to search for duplicate files, bad shortcuts and more ! RegSeeker is FREE for personal use only !" Wow! urlLink Powered By Unreal Technology : "Unreal Engine 3 Unreal Engine 3 is a complete game development framework for next-generation consoles and DirectX9-equipped PC's, providing the vast array of core technologies, content creation tools, and support infrastructure required by top game developers. Every aspect of the Unreal Engine has been designed with ease of content creation and programming in mind, with the goal of putting as much power as possible in the hands of artists to develop assets in a visual environment with minimal programmer assistance; and to give programmers a highly modular and extensible framework for building, testing, and shipping games in a wide range of genres." A lot of interesting info.

urlLink Reuters | Latest Financial News / Full News Coverage : "'Doom' creator Id soon to start on new game Thu 13 May, 2004 03:33 By Ben Berkowitz LOS ANGELES (Reuters) - Video game developer id Software, famed creators of games like 'Doom' and 'Quake', will likely start work on its new project almost immediately after completing four years of work on 'Doom 3', its chief executive says. In an interview with Reuters on the sidelines of the video game industry trade show E3 here, Todd Hollenshead said that the game in question was new intellectual property, and was not a 'Doom', 'Quake' or 'Wolfenstein' game. He offered few details on the style or content of the game, other than to say the id team would start serious work on it in short order, possibly a matter of days, after moving on from the PC and later Xbox releases of the new 'Doom 3'." Hmm..I want to know what it will be.

urlLink Yahoo boosts free e-mail storage to 100MB | CNET News.com : "Web portal Yahoo will begin offering 'virtually unlimited storage' for its paid e-mail customers and will upgrade free users to 100MB, an executive said Thursday. The upgrade is part of an overall enhancement for Yahoo Mail that will launch this summer. Besides additional storage, the service will get a face-lift and tie in more Yahoo-branded services, such as Photos and Messenger. The announcement comes a month after search rival Google said it would launch a free e-mail service called Gmail that offers 1GB of storage, considerably more space than free versions of Yahoo Mail and Microsoft's Hotmail. Yahoo currently offers 4MB of storage to free users of its e-mail service. The company's decision to boost its e-mail storage is not surprising. A day before Gmail details were unveiled, Yahoo sent e-mails to some customers in hopes of gauging their interest in receiving 100MB of storage. The company said the e-mail was just a typical consumer survey for its 'loyal consumer base' and denied that it had any relation to the news of Gmail." Found this to be interesting.

For some reason i felt like writing a poem so here it is... No need to be sad Why must you always do this to me, Acting so smug it makes me crazy. You act like you don't care, Pretending you don't have to play fair. All I want is to be your friend, But I guess your heart is a heart i can never mend. You always act so tough, Because your life has been so rough. Even though everyone knows that deep inside, Your so sad that you contemplate suicide. I wish I could do something to help you, Because its hard to see you so blue Please let me into your life, Before you resort to a knife. Living really isn't that bad, If you have friends to make you glad. ...well at least it rhymes, hope you like it

urlLink Boston.com / News / World / Militants in Iraq behead South Korean hostage, then U.S. launches airstrike on safehouse : "Islamic militants Tuesday beheaded a South Korean who pleaded in a heart-wrenching videotape that ''I don't want to die'' after his government refused to pull its troops from Iraq. He was the third foreign hostage decapitated in the Middle East in little over a month." Poor Bastard, This is getting out of hand. Three people this month. I just hope we don't give in to them because of this, we do that and it'll give them something to work with. As long as we don't give in threats like this, they can't win.

urlLink Apple tapped for Defense Dept. research supercomputer - Computerworld : "Apple Computer Inc. took a step forward and a step backward yesterday in its quest to prove itself a viable player in the world of high-performance computing. The computer vendor announced a deal with U.S. Army contractor Colsa Corp. to build a 1,566-node supercomputer that's expected to be capable of as many as 25 trillion floating-point operations per second (TFLOPS), according to Colsa. Called MACH 5 (Multiple Advanced Computers for Hypersonic Research), the $5.8 million system is designed to do aero-thermodynamic modeling for the Army's Missile Research, Development and Engineering Center. It's expected to be operational by November and, if it were benchmarked today, would rank just behind the Japan Marine Science and Technology Center's $350 million Earth Simulator, Colsa said. That hardware is capable of 35.9TFLOPS." Oooh, I want a supercomputer. Hahaha, it's $345 Million less than the fastest one, and is about 4/9 as powerful. Crazy, but good. Soon everyone will have Supercomputers. I wonder when the limit will be drawn, how far can we go with computers? I guess I'll just have to see.

urlLink I.T. Vibe - RIAA sue another 482 song swappers : "The Recording Industry Association of America (RIAA) are on the war path again and have sued 482 people for copyright infringement. This brings the total people sued by the RIAA to well over 3,400. We have often reported in the past on the music body and their on going anti-piracy campaign, aimed specifically at people who swap or download music on the Internet using peer-to-peer network services such as those provided by Kazaa. All of the 482 suits filed are in America." Damn it, they really need to stop doing this, it's pissing me off.

urlLink Yahoo! News - Apple Launches Faster Power Mac G5 Computer : "Apple Computer Inc. rolled out its fastest-ever desktop computer on Wednesday with processors that run as fast as 2.5 gigahertz, but the company fell short of its earlier goal to offer a 3.0 gigahertz chip-based system by this month. Apple has been counting on its chip supplier, IBM, to shrink the size of components to permit higher speeds for its microprocessors, the brains that run a computer. As more transistors are fit onto smaller circuits, the speed at which a processor can run increases." For all of the Macophiles out there. 2.5 Ghz is pretty nice, to bad Macs cost so much, I may have considered one.

urlLink Top News Article | Reuters.com : "LOS ANGELES (Reuters) - Former U.S. President Ronald Reagan, who forged a conservative revolution that transformed American politics, died on Saturday after a decade-long battle with Alzheimer's disease, U.S. media reported. He was 93." Poor Reagan, I guess it's a release from not being to remember anything about your life, but still sad.

urlLink ATI admits to same "tricks" as Nvidia - News at GameSpot : "Graphics company ATI, longtime critic of competitor Nvidia's video card driver optimizations, concedes to using undocumented optimizations of its own. After criticizing rival Nvidia for using optimized trilinear filtering algorithms in its PC graphics card drivers--calling them 'unacceptable tricks' in a recent presentation to hardware reviewers last month--ATI Technologies has acknowledged using similar optimizations itself." Well, you have to do what you have to do. I wonder how many people ATI or Nvidia think they are winning over by using "tricks" to make there cards look better.

urlLink BBC NEWS | Technology | Potter-mania fuels pesky virus : "A pesky computer virus is taking advantage of the excitement surrounding the latest Harry Potter film. The Netsky.P worm is enjoying a resurgence by disguising itself as a Potter game, say anti-virus experts." That's pretty sad. Parents really need to start teaching there kids what to and what not to do on the internet. How hard is it to tell them not to click on anything or just limit them to a few safe sites. And if they are getting these things off p2p networks, parents shouldn't allow there kids to use them.

My 80th post, wow, I actually never thought I would be able to keep up a blog this long. The house is just about done, I think the carpeting got put in today and the 2nd floor has been painted, it's looking very good so far. I'm hoping to get my computer before school starts, but it probably won't happen, something always seems to get in the way.

I don't think I've talked about me giving up pop on this Blog. It all started the day after Independence Day, July 5. I just decided that pop was bad for me and that I shouldn't drink it anymore. I haven't had a pop since that day, which is a long time for someone who used to drink 1-2 liters of pop a day. I was kind of afraid of getting headaches and such from the withdrawal from caffeine, but I didn't have any. Sunday is usually a slow day for me so I really can't think of anything else, hopefully Monday will be more exciting.

A day at work makes me realize how easy a life I have, while other kids my age are working at a Fast Food restaraunt or bagging groceries, I'm surfing the net and putting books away, what a great life I live. Now that everyone hates how easy my life is, I'll move on to something else. What is up with the ilovebees.com thing and Halo 2? That is just weird, for more info, check out urlLink Slashdot , crazy and weird is what it is. Hope you like the revisions that I made to my blog, looks alot better now, at least in my eyes. The whole getting a computer thing is moving along slowly, as I grapple with myself over whether I want to spend my money on a computer, don't worry, the bad half of me will win in the end;)
